definitions.definition: estimate, measure, or note the similarity or dissimilarity between.
examples: individual schools compared their facilities with those of others in the area

definitions.definition: point out the resemblances to; liken to.
examples: her novel was compared to the work of Daniel Defoe
synonyms: set side by side with "he was compared to Wagner"

definitions.definition: draw an analogy between one thing and (another) for the purposes of explanation or clarification.
examples: he compared the religions to different paths toward the peak of the same mountain

definitions.definition: have a specified relationship with another thing or person in terms of nature or quality.
examples: salaries compare favorably with those of other professions
synonyms: be in the same league as
approach "the porcelain compares with Dresden's fine china"

definitions.definition: be of an equal or similar nature or quality.
examples: sales were modest and cannot compare with the glory days of 1989

definitions.definition: form the comparative and superlative degrees of (an adjective or an adverb).
examples: words of one syllable are usually compared by “-er” and “-est.”
